newsitem.title: USA: Tobacco stocks rise on anticipation of settlement.
newsitem.headline: Tobacco stocks rise on anticipation of settlement.

text.p: Tobacco stocks rose on Thursday as investors anticipated liability settlement talks could soon yield an agreement, traders said.
In Washington negotiators for states and the tobacco industry were trying to resolve contentious issues Thursday and reach a landmark settlement of lawsuits by the end of the week.
Philip Morris Cos Inc topped the New York Stock Exchange's most actives list, rising 2-3/8 to year high of 47-7/8 by midafternoon. RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp jumped 1-1/4 to 35-3/4.
American Depositary Receipts of B.A.T Industries Plc, parent of Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corp, rose one to 19-7/8.
Loews Corp, parent of Lorillard Tobacco Co, gained four to 106-3/4.
UST Inc, parent of smokeless tobacco maker United States Tobacco Co, tacked on 3/4 to 30.

"If a settlement comes, it's good. And if we don't get one, it might be bad. But these stocks are moving a lot. You get a whisper and they go one way, another whisper and it goes the other way," said Warren Epstein, director of trading at Richard Rosenblatt.
